intro: Psychotria ceratantha, commonly known as the "Blue Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to blue, depending on the species. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture. Psychotria ceratantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
